cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 110 mi SE of Isla Beata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, expected to turn northwest across Cuba and then toward the Florida Straits and the Florida Peninsula/Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west coast of Florida near the Big Bend/Tampa–Cedar Key area

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches posted for Florida as of Advisory 12A
weather_observation.warning_coast: No warnings posted for Florida as of Advisory 12A
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern Hispaniola, Jamaica, Cuba, Florida Keys and peninsula, eventually the northeast Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Tuesday as Elsa passes to the west of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge less than 2 ft possible along the immediate coast and inlets; significant (>3 ft) surge not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands could bring 1–3 in of rain with localized 4 in early next week.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents beginning late Monday, possible temporary channel restrictions for cruise and cargo traffic.
